title.narrative: Creating a dialogue space for communities in cross-border dioceses of Nyundo(Rwanda) and Goma (DRC)

description.narrative: As everywhere in Rwanda, the population of the Diocese of Nyundo suffered from the genocide against the Tutsi in 1994 and insecurity from FDLRs that challenged consequently social cohesion between local populations. General security situation is currently improved in Rwanda but cross-border communities live in prejudices, suspicions and mistrust that make each community develops a certain fear which sometimes leads to violence. In other side, risks of population manipulation linked to ethnicity remain high without peace education for youths. The project aims to contribute to a good coexistence without mistrust and violence for cross-border communities living in Nyundo and Goma dioceses when running to general elections in Rwanda and DRC the next two years. Project plans to improve peaceful cohabitation within cross-border communities (especially youths and women) through trainings on responsible citizenship and good electoral practices, radio broadcasting to build relationships focused on peace and reconciliation values as well as sensitization on no violence and respect of Human Rights. Project intends to a good coexistence and good election in which people participate without political manipulation that could lead to violence. It also intends to set up a framework for cooperation and exchange as permanent space for dialog for cross-border youths and women “dynamiques femmes” to enable them to break the mistrust and suspicion which contribute to enabling peace. Activities will be implemented in the Nyundo Diocese located to the west of the Republic of Rwanda and in the city of Goma and its surroundings.
